title: Mum's heartfelt plea after losing tragic Scott Hetherington's dog tags
text:

The grieving mum of a Middleton soldier killed in Iraq has suffered further heartache after losing her late son’s dog tags and St Christopher pendant. 
Lance Corporal Scott Hetherington died aged 22 in a “tragic accident” last month, while serving with The 2nd Battalion The Duke of Lancaster’s Regiment. 
His mother Anne Hetherington was training for the Three Peaks’ Challenge on Pen-y-ghent, in the Yorkshire Dales, on Sunday when the tags fell off. She is scaling the three highest peaks in Yorkshire to raise money for Lance Corporal Hetherington’s four-month old daughter Safaya-Rose. 
It would mean “the absolute world” if she got the tags back, said Anne. Lance Corporal Scott Hetherington while serving in the Falklands. (Photo: Facebook (Aaron Hetherington)) 
“I’ve got Scott back a bit when I touch them," she said. "Because I know he had them on. 
“They’ve gone through Afghanistan, The Falklands. They’ve been everywhere with him. I never thought they’d come undone.” Read More This is the future of Manchester Airport - featuring a showcase 'Super Terminal' after a £1bn expansion 
Anne realised the tags were missing on her way home. The chains were still around her neck, but they had come undone and the tags had slipped off. 
She started the climb at 10am, taking the red route up and the gentle slope down on the opposite side. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
